articles.headline: Robots Ride to the Rescue Where Workers Can’t Be Found
articles.snippet: Fast-growing economies in Eastern Europe have led to severe labor shortages, so companies are calling in the machines.
articles.abstract: Fast-growing economies in Eastern Europe have led to severe labor shortages, so companies are calling in the machines.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRAGUE — When Zbynek Frolik needed new employees to handle surging orders at his cavernous factories in central Bohemia, he fanned advertisements across the Czech Republic. But in a prosperous economy where nearly everyone had work, there were few takers.

articles.headline: New York Times and New Yorker Share Pulitzer for Public Service
articles.snippet: Reporting on sexual harassment — including the predations of the film mogul Harvey Weinstein — was recognized by the Pulitzer board. The New York Times won in three categories.
articles.abstract: Reporting on sexual harassment — including the predations of the film mogul Harvey Weinstein — was recognized by the Pulitzer board. The New York Times won in three categories.
articles.lead_paragraph: Pulitzer Prizes were awarded on Monday to the news organizations that drove two of the biggest stories of the year: the high-stakes investigation into President Trump’s relationship with Russia and the consequential reckoning about the treatment of women by powerful men.

articles.headline: Sean Hannity Is Named as Client of Michael Cohen, Trump’s Lawyer
articles.snippet: Lawyers for Mr. Cohen, the president’s personal lawyer, had sought to keep Mr. Hannity’s identity a secret in a court challenge of an F.B.I. search of Mr. Cohen’s office.
articles.abstract: Lawyers for Mr. Cohen, the president’s personal lawyer, had sought to keep Mr. Hannity’s identity a secret in a court challenge of an F.B.I. search of Mr. Cohen’s office.
articles.lead_paragraph: From his Fox News pulpit, Sean Hannity has been one of the most ardent supporters of President Trump, cheering his agenda and excoriating his enemies.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer, Michael M. Grynbaum and John Koblin

articles.headline: Marriott’s New Loyalty Program: Not as Bad as Starwood Fans Feared
articles.snippet: When Marriott acquired Starwood Hotels, Starwood Preferred Guest members feared the worst. Our resident Starwood fan thinks the new program is worth trying.
articles.abstract: When Marriott acquired Starwood Hotels, Starwood Preferred Guest members feared the worst. Our resident Starwood fan thinks the new program is worth trying.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the nearly two and a half years since Marriott announced its intention to acquire Starwood Hotels and Resorts, the parent of Westin, Sheraton and W, skeptical customers of both companies have waited impatiently for answers to the following question: Just how many rewards and perks would Marriott take away from the 110 million members when it combined the loyalty programs?

articles.headline: Chinese Tech Company Blocked From Buying American Components
articles.snippet: The Trump administration said Monday that it was halting exports from the United States to ZTE Corporation, a blow to one of China’s best-known firms.
articles.abstract: The Trump administration said Monday that it was halting exports from the United States to ZTE Corporation, a blow to one of China’s best-known firms.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — China’s second-largest maker of telecommunications equipment will not be able to use components made in the United States after the Commerce Department said it failed to punish employees who violated American sanctions against Iran and North Korea.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: James Comey’s Attacks on Trump May Hurt a Carefully Cultivated Image
articles.snippet: In media appearances aimed in part at increasing book sales, Mr. Comey is criticizing the president in personal ways that are unusual for a former F.B.I. director.
articles.abstract: In media appearances aimed in part at increasing book sales, Mr. Comey is criticizing the president in personal ways that are unusual for a former F.B.I. director.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For decades, James B. Comey cultivated an image of purity as a lawman who stood above politics and politicians.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Trump Declines to Add Sanctions Against Russians, Contradicting Haley
articles.snippet: The administration reversed course a day after announcing that it would penalize Russian companies for facilitating Syria’s chemical weapons program.
articles.abstract: The administration reversed course a day after announcing that it would penalize Russian companies for facilitating Syria’s chemical weapons program.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump rejected, for now at least, a fresh round of sanctions set to be imposed against Russia on Monday, a course change that underscored the schism between the president and his national security team.

articles.headline: Tech Firms Sign ‘Digital Geneva Accord’ Not to Aid Governments in Cyberwar
articles.snippet: The companies, including Microsoft and Facebook, hope to create a Geneva Conventions for cyberspace, but none are from countries that are suspected in most of the recent attacks.
articles.abstract: The companies, including Microsoft and Facebook, hope to create a Geneva Conventions for cyberspace, but none are from countries that are suspected in most of the recent attacks.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — More than 30 high-tech companies, led by Microsoft and Facebook, announced a set of principles on Tuesday that included a declaration that they would not help any government — including that of the United States — mount cyberattacks against “innocent civilians and enterprises from anywhere,” reflecting Silicon Valley’s effort to separate itself from government cyberwarfare.

articles.headline: China Loosens Foreign Auto Rules, in Potential Peace Offering to Trump
articles.snippet: Beijing said makers of electric cars would no longer be required to find a Chinese partner, with the rest of the auto industry to follow.
articles.abstract: Beijing said makers of electric cars would no longer be required to find a Chinese partner, with the rest of the auto industry to follow.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHANGHAI — Beijing and Washington have threatened each other with tariffs for weeks, raising the prospect of a trade war. But on Tuesday, China took a step to lower tensions, offering to make it easier for foreign automakers and aerospace manufacturers to own factories in the country.

articles.headline: Facebook Is Creepy. And Valuable.
articles.snippet: To protect the public without overreacting, the issue for legislators and regulators to weigh is how much the data-driven ecosystem is worth to us.
articles.abstract: To protect the public without overreacting, the issue for legislators and regulators to weigh is how much the data-driven ecosystem is worth to us.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the most telling moments in the spectacle of Mark Zuckerberg’s congressional testimony last week was when Representative Billy Long, a Missouri Republican, warned the co-founder of Facebook of what Congress was likely to do about its multiple concerns surrounding the social network. “Congress is good at two things: doing nothing, and overreacting,” he said. After years of the former, he said, “we’re getting ready to overreact.”

articles.headline: In Journalist’s Murder, a Test for Malta, and the European Union
articles.snippet: Three career criminals have been arrested in the killing of Daphne Caruana Galizia, but her family fears a cover-up because of the powerful interests involved.
articles.abstract: Three career criminals have been arrested in the killing of Daphne Caruana Galizia, but her family fears a cover-up because of the powerful interests involved.
articles.lead_paragraph: BIDNIJA, Malta — On Oct. 16, at 1:41 a.m., a cellphone SIM card was activated in this rural Maltese village. It was the moment, investigators say, when a remote-controlled bomb packed with TNT was armed and placed under the driver’s seat of this tiny country’s most famous, and most provocative, journalist.
